text:
sweet. and something else says to put spaces in the props.isSubmitting -- which seems like you don't need to do it, but also seems to be the correct syntax vs. how it is now.

meaning: {props.isSubmitting ? "Loading" : "Register"} vs. {props.isSubmitting?"Loading":"Register"}

text: <@U0578M93BPE> - do you have a status or progress update on refactoring (aka updating) the login form so that it includes the Yup validation, using Formik and the axios post request?

elements.text: - do you have a status or progress update on refactoring (aka updating) the login form so that it includes the Yup validation, using Formik and the axios post request?
Yes but it wasn't  finished.
I am working on authentication

Sounds good.

Two things I figured out when trying to test the Logout in case it is helpful to you as you work on authentication.

Item 1:
We will need a parent component, something like "User Management" that sets the headersObj that is then passed to both Login and Logout functions as a prop

The reason is because:

elements.Raw: {"type":"rich_text_list","elements":[{"type":"rich_text_section","elements":[{"type":"text","text":"When a user logs in, the server assigns a sessionId and sets a Cookie that is sent back with the response"}]},{"type":"rich_text_section","elements":[{"type":"text","text":"And we need to be able to then pass the values to the Logout component so that we can use that sessionId when the user logs out"}]}],"style":"ordered","indent":0,"border":0}

elements.text:
Item #2:
In the post, we also need to include withCredentials: true, which allows the cookie to be sent and received so you will have to add this to Login if you don't have it already.

Here is what it looks like in my login component so far:
and here is the UserManagement component but as you can see, we would have to integrate it with Login:

text:
also, I think Yumi will end up using that User Management component for authentication to validate a user is logged in before granting them access to secure pages as well.
